comment._content: They definitely look related... a lovely portrait capture of elegance!!!

comment.author: 30687643@N00
comment._content: according to the 1901 census they were sisters.....http://www.census.nationalarchives.ie/reels/nai001233047/

comment.author: 22575440@N07
comment._content: with that kinky head of hair on them, I knew they had to be related! : )

comment.author: 30687643@N00
comment._content: Mrs Rowley lists herself as a widow which would explain the black (or dark) dress. In the 1911 census she no longer has her sister living there but a 39 year old male boarder (!)

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/mogey] A dentist from England, no less! Thanks a million for the investigative work.

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/mogey] Your link did not work for me, so here is my link for you... www.census.nationalarchives.ie/pages/1901/Waterford/Water... If the house numbers are still the same, then this is No2 The Mall, Waterford. maps.osi.ie/publicviewer/#V1,661073,612443,7,3 It looks a sad building today on Google Street View maps.google.co.uk/maps?q=Waterford,+Ireland&hl=en&...

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: This is a very fine portrait of a very elegant pair of sisters and it's terrific that they have been identified and their home located.  Nice one!

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: Interesting new website has an old photo of Reginald's Tower when No1 The Mall was built against the Tower. There is a gap now between No2 and the Tower. www.whatwasthere.com/browse.aspx#!/ll/52.260602,-7.104965...

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/blackpoolbeach] Taken from almost exactly the same angle as one of our Lawrence Collection - from up in the Adelphi Hotel, presumably...

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/blackpoolbeach] He does indeed! And has been a great help to us all in adding information and locations, and solving mysteries with Waterford photos...
